Subject: Out of the Frying pan, into the INFERNO
References: <9ipt96+dp21@...> <3B50AB8D.EC2@...> <4D2F8AEA.6D023EC3.0253A9AC@...> <3B512991.7833@...> <105A2AE9.0385051F.0253A9AC@...> <3B522B75.372C@...> <529F42C2.67DF95BB.0253A9AC@...>
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
From: robertdahl <rdahl@...>

"I'm dead." Is all Caliburst could think to himself. There he was,
stranded millions of lightyears away from home, without his binary
partner, beside a ship of Autobots. "I'm real dead." he whispered
quietly. He turned around, and looked down at Slugslinger's bashed up
body, and he sneered. He pulled his leg back, and gave SLugslinger a
good kick. "Wake up." he shouted. Maybe he should try to find the
others, but how? he couldn't fly, and who knows what creatures inhabited
this planet. For the first time, since he joined the Decepticon army, he
felt very much alone. He looked down towards the ground, but lifted his
head sudenly when he heard a noise over a hill. He quickly rushed up to
it, his laser pistol pulled, and peered over it.

Over the the rough terrain, a red earth vehicle, dated to about 1984,
Caliburst guessed, traversed the terrain quickly. But if his internal
circuits were right, they werent in 1984, they were much further back.
"Autobot." He whispered to himself, as he slid back down the hill to
avoid detection. He cocked his rifle, and turned around to crawl back
up, and took aim on the ever closing in car. His fingers quivered, his
jaw chattered, as his finger pulled back. The laser flashed from the
barrel of his pistol, and ripped throught the air, then through metal of
Cliffjumper's hood. Cliffjumper screams filled the valley, as he
swerves, blinded by the pain, and rolls on to his roof, wheels still
spinning madly. Caliburst ducks back down, and smiles at the Autobots
screams of pain..
